飢餓的;顯出飢餓樣子的
(me, my, mine, myself)我(第一人稱單數主格,指說者、作者自己,所有格為my,受格為me)
有趣的;引起興趣的;令人關注的[(+for/to)]
(its, itself)(指已提及或心目中的人或事物)這,那,它
斜紋布工作褲;(尤指)工裝褲,牛仔褲
風箏, 騙子,貪心的人
(leave的過去式和過去分詞), 左方的;左側的[Z][B]
(人,動物)躺,臥;(東西)被平放[Q], 撒謊
痕跡;污點;瘢疤[C], 記號;符號;標記[C]
百萬;百萬元(鎊,美元,法郎等)
n. 頭腦,智力[C][U]; vt. 注意,留意,記住要[+(that)][+wh-]
(用于姓名或姓之前, 尤指對未婚女子的稱呼) 女士, 小姐
未擊中;未得到;未達到;未看到;未聽到;未領會[+v-ing], (通常大寫)(用於姓名或姓之前,尤指對未婚女子的稱呼)小姐[C]
(many, much的比較級)更多的;更高程度的[+(than)]
(many, much的最高級)最多的;最高程度的
(mister之簡稱;用於男士的姓,姓名或職務之前)先生[C]
(mistress之簡稱;用於已婚女性的夫姓或夫的姓名之前)夫人,太太[C]
女士(用於婚姻狀況不明或不願提及婚姻狀況之女性的姓或姓名之前)
許多;大量的;很大程度的
(表示必要,命令或強制)必須,得
好的;美好的,宜人的;可愛的
一對,一雙,(兩部分形成的)一件[C][(+of)]
(自帶食物的)郊遊,野餐;(個人自帶食品的)聚餐[C]
(塗有番茄醬、乳酪等的)義大利肉餡餅;比薩餅
遊戲的人;打牌的人;下棋的人
(學校的)操場,運動場;(兒童)遊樂場
使高興,使喜歡,使滿意[W], (用於請求或命令)請
有禮貌的,客氣的;殷勤的
(用於女性,小孩及小物件)漂亮的;秀麗的;可愛的
無線電;無線電話(或電報)[U][C]
真的,真正的;衷心的;真誠的
冰箱,雪櫃;冷藏室;冷凍庫[C]
騎馬,乘車;騎馬(或乘車)旅行[Q]
a. 右的,右邊的,右側的[B], 正確的,準確的[(+in)]
Republic of China 中華民國
悲哀的;令人悲痛的,可悲的
安全的,無危險的,保險的[F][(+from)]
嚴重的;危急的;令人擔心的
(用於第一人稱,表示將來)將,會
一份,份兒;(分擔的)一部分[S][(+in/of)], 股份;股票[C][(+in)]
(修飾名詞的單數形)某一,某個
運動的;(指衣服等)適用於運動的

note_zh:
n.胃；胃口；腹部
vt.忍受；吃得下

1. He had had too much to eat and his stomach started to kick up.
他吃得太多了,胃不舒服。
2. Anxiety may disorder the stomach.
忧虑可能会引起胃部不适。
3. The stomach revolts at such food.
这样的食物倒胃囗。
4. The film about eye operations turned my stomach.
这部眼科手术的影片看得我恶心极了。
5. I can't stomach your constant nagging.
我再也忍受不了你不停的唠叨了。

zh: 奇怪的,奇妙的,不可思議的
成功的;結果圓滿的;勝利的[(+in)]
陽光充足的;和煦的,暖和的
感到驚訝的;出人意外的
那;那個,那人,那事,那東西
(them, their, theirs, themselves)(主格)他們;她們;它們
這,這個,這人,這事,這東西
伯父;叔父;姑父;姨丈;舅父
不幸福的,不愉快的;痛苦的
United States of America 美利堅合眾國
有用的;有益的;有幫助的[(+to/for/in)]
休假;假期;休庭期;休假日
穿著;戴著;佩帶著;塗抹(香水,化妝品)

note_zh:
Define weather : ['weðər]
n.天气；气象；境遇
vt.使风化；经受住；使日晒雨淋
vi.风化；褪色；经受风雨
adj.上风的；天气预报的

例句与用法:
1. What is the weather like today?
今天天气情况怎样？
2. The meteorologist drew a picture of the weather.
气象学者画了一张气象图。
3. The past years had known him in many weathers.
过去的岁月里,他起起落落。
4. The rocks on the mountain have to be weathered by wind and water.
山上的岩石得经受风化和水蚀。
5. The paint on the walls had weathered.
墙壁上的涂料已经风干了。
6. Fill in the form below about the weather report.
续下面关于天气预报的表格。

词形变化:
过去式: weathered 过去分词: weathered 现在分词: weathering 第三人称单数: weathers

查看详细解释

zh: (用作疑問副詞)什麼時候,何時
(用作疑問副詞)在哪裡;往哪裡;從哪裡;在哪一點上
(用作疑問代名詞)哪一個,哪一些
妻子,太太,夫人;已婚婦女
轉動(把手),搖;(用絞車)絞起,吊起
年輕的;幼小的;青春時期的

note_zh:
1. He aimed his gun at the eagle spreading its wings.
他的枪瞄准那只展开翅膀的老鹰。
2. She aimed a pistol at the bandit point-blank.
她用手枪直接瞄准强盗。
3. The aim of damages is to compensate the plaintiff.
损害赔偿的目的在于赔偿原告的损失。
4. The measures were aimed at shoring up the economy.
采取这些措施，目的在于稳定经济。
note_en: To point a weapon at someone or something.

note_zh:
1. Could I ask for your reaction to this policy?
我能问一下您对这个政策的反应吗？
2. He's too spineless to ask for more money.
他没有勇气要求更多的钱。
3. We ask for a return to democratic government.
我们要求恢复民主政体。
4. Jack was brought to account for the missing cash.
杰克被要求对这笔遗失的现金作出解释。
note_en: To request something.

note_zh:
1. She was trigged out in her best for the date.
为了约会，她进行了精心的打扮。
2. My mother tries to stop me going out on dates.
我母亲试图阻止我外出赴男孩子的约会。
note_en: When you ask someone to go with you to a certain place or for a special occasion, to spend time together and have fun. If one or both parties involved are interested in a romantic way, then it is considered a date.

note_zh:
1. He refused to back away from his position.
他拒绝放弃自己的立场。
2. I saw that she was right,so I had to back down.
我发现她是对的，所以只好放弃原来的意见。
3. He forced his opponent to back down.
他迫使对手让步。
4. The wife appeased her husband and went back home.
妻子对她丈夫的要求做了让步，回家去了。
note_en: To withdraw your position in a fight, argument, plan, etc.

zh: 后退；放弃，撤回（主张等）；倒车；让步，屈服
note_zh:
1. I saw the knife and backed off.
我看见了那把刀,向后退去。
2. He refused to back away from his position.
他拒绝放弃自己的立场。
note_en: When you leave an emotional situation, or to allow someone to handle something alone.

zh:
vi.(因积聚而)拥堵；堵塞
vt.支持；援助；倒退；（资料）备份
note_zh:
1. Because congestion prevents ships heading back to pick up new cargoes, it has helped to push prices up further.
由于拥堵使船只难以返回运载新的货物，起到了进一步推高价格的作用。
2. Some drivers will switch to the bridge to shorten theircommute, but as the traffic builds up there the motorway starts to look like abetter bet, so some switch back.
一些司机为了缩短行程选择走桥，但当桥上变得拥堵时，高速路似乎是更好的选择，因此一些司机又折返回来走桥。
3. The fire won't burn because the flue is blocked up.
因烟道堵塞火烧不起来。
4. Clogged pipes backed up drain water.
阻塞的水管堵塞了沟水。
5. She has almost nobody to take up for her.
她几乎没有人支持。
note_en: To walk or drive a vehicle backwards.

zh: v.痛打；搅拌；召集；惊扰；逆风而行
note_zh:
1. He is badly beat up by a gang of thug.
他被一帮暴徒打得死去活来。
2. The tough boy said to Bill, "If you come around here again, I'll beat up you."
这个野孩子对比尔说：“如果你再到这里来瞎转，我就狠狠打你一顿。
3. Beat up the yolks of three eggs.
把三个蛋黄搅匀。
4. Run and beat up the men quickly.
快去把人召集起来。
note_en: When someone punches, kicks, or hits someone repeatedly using fists or with an object.

note_zh:
1. The government decided to beef up its air force by buying a number of new fighters.
该政府决定购买一批新战机，以增强其空军实力。
2. The new evidence beefed up their case.
有了新的证据，他们的理由更充足了。
note_en: To make changes or an improvement.

note_zh:
1. She did not believe in his professions of love.
她不相信他的爱情表白是真的。
2. I believe he has started reading up anthropology.
我相信他已开始攻读人类学。
3. We have confidence in the mayor.
我们信任这位市长。
4. She has implicit trust in her secretary.
她对自己的秘书绝对信任。
note_en: To feel confident about something or someone.

note_zh:
1. Our dog bit off its collar and ran away.
我们的狗咬掉自己的环跑了。
2. You've bitten off the end of your pipe.
你把烟斗的嘴都咬掉啦。
note_en: To use your teeth to bite a piece of something.

zh: 吹走； 刮走； 强烈影响； 征服
note_zh:
1. Beware your hat, lest it should be blown away.
当心你的帽子别被吹走。
2. Her optimism whistled away these worries.
她的乐观吹走了这些烦恼。
3. The cold bleak winds swept the leaves away.
刺骨的冷风把树叶刮走了。
4. Several ships broke away from their moorings in the storm.
有好几艘船在暴风雨中从系泊处被刮走了。
note_en: When the wind moves an object or person from where it was.

note_zh:
1. My hat blew off while I was crossing the street.
当我过街时，帽子吹掉了。
2. Exterior doors were blown off their hinges.
外面的门被风从门轴上吹掉下来。
note_en: When the wind removes something from its place.

zh: 吹灭(突然爆裂； 吹胀； 突然冒出； 烧断)
note_zh:
1. You can blow up any condoms with air that the members of the boat have on their person and attach the glow sticks and allow them to trail your boat.
此时，如果船上成员随身携带了套套的话，你可以将他们吹胀并把信号棒捆绑在上面，再让它尾随在船后头。
2. The signal flamed out on the hilltop.
山顶上突然冒出火焰作信号。
3. The bearded old man springing out of the central disc symbolizes the human soul.
从圆盘中央突然冒出的有须老人是代表人类的灵魂。
note_en: To extinguish or make a flame stop burning.

note_zh:
v.爆炸；充气；放大；大怒；加剧；刮起（风暴）

1. The terrorists are threatening to blow up the hijacked airliner.
恐怖分子扬言要炸毁劫持的客机。
2. Can you lend me a pump to blow up my bicycle tyres?
你能借给我个打气筒给车胎打打气吗?
3. He has blown up the print as large as it will go.
他已经把这张正片尽量放大。
4. He was edgy and irritable.It was conceivable that he could blow up.
他急躁易怒，可以想到他是会发火的。
note_en: To make something explode.

note_zh:
1. The advice they gave him boiled down to this: he should take care of his own health.
他们给他的劝告可归结为一句话：他应该注意自己的身体。
2. The issue really boils down to a clash between left and right.
这场争论确实可归结为左派与右派之间的冲突。
3. We boil down to these questions to a point.
我们把这些问题归结为一点。
note_en: To have determined or analyzed the solution or reason for something.

note_zh:
分解；发生故障；失败；毁掉；将…分类；衰弱，体力不支；制服，镇压

1. The machine must break down at this busy hour.
正忙的时候，机器偏偏又坏了。
2. He finally break down under the four-hour's strain.
在四小时的压力下他终于支持不了。
note_en: When someone loses self-control and is emotionally and/or mentally agitated. This meaning has a noun form for a situation where someone loses self-control.

zh: 闯入； 打断； 使驯服； 训练成为
note_zh:
1. The nosy couple broke in on our conversation.
那对好管闲事的夫妇闯入我们的交谈。
2. Please don't break in on our conversation.
请不要打断我们的谈话。
note_en: To enter a place illegally and with the use of force.

zh: 突然住口；折断；断绝(关系)；暂停(工作)，休息一会
note_zh:
1. He broke off in the middle of a sentence.
他一句话只说了一半就停住了。
2. The door handle has broken off.
门的把手断了。
3. She broke off a piece of chocolate and gave it to me.
她掰下一块巧克力给我。
4. He broke off relations with his family.
他与家庭断绝了一切联系。
note_en: To remove a part of something with force.

note_zh:
1. A quarrel broke out between them.
他们间爆发了一场争吵。
2. He predicted that war would break out in the next few years.
他预言战争将在下几年中爆发。
note_en: To escape from a place, situation or way of life.

note_zh:
1. I know we could break through it.
我知道我们能突破。
2. The enemy is trying to break through.
敌人企图突围。
note_en: To make a way through a barrier or a surface.

zh: 结束，散会；解散，驱散；关系破裂，离异；衰弱
note_zh:
1. The stricken tanker began to break up on the rocks.
油轮被击中后撞上礁石,毁了。
2. They decided to break up the partnership.
他们决定终止合作关系。
note_en: To stop a fight.

zh: 带回来； 使记起； 使恢复
note_zh:
1. Please bring back my notebook from the classroom.
请帮我把笔记本从教室里带回来。
2. We bring to his widow his sword and cross of honor.
我们把他的佩剑和十字荣誉勋章带回来给他的太太。
note_en: To return something you’ve borrowed.

note_zh:
1. Next summer he hopes to bring his family over from the States.
他希望明年夏天把他一家人从美国接来。
note_en: To bring someone or something from one place or area to another.

note_zh:
提出；教育；养育；呕出；（船等）停下

1. These are matters that you can bring up in committee.
这些问题你可在委员会中提出。
2. The couple contrived to bring up their children on a small income.
这对夫妻设法以菲薄的收入把孩子扶养成人。
note_en: To bring something from a lower level/place to a higher level/place.

zh: 刷掉； 不理； 漠视
note_zh:
1. Brush off the fuzz that has blown on.
把被风吹上去的绒毛刷掉。
2. Mud brushes off easily when it is dry.
泥巴干了容易刷掉。
3. They brush off the charges without any comment.
他们不理不睬那指控，也未作任何解释。
4. In fine, all Sedley's wealthy friends had dropped off one by one.
总之，赛特笠的有钱朋友慢慢的都不理他了。
note_en: To remove something(dust particle, insect, etc) with your hand.

note_zh:
1. I am going to rub up the chromium on the car.
我准备把汽车上的镀铬部件擦亮。
2. Buff up the paintwork with a soft cloth.
用块柔软的布把漆面擦亮。
3. He wants to brush up his knowledge of electronics.
他想温习他的电子学知识。
4. Mr. Jones wanted to Brush up onhis computer skills.
琼斯先生想要温习他的计算机技术。
note_en: To practice and review your knowledge or a skill that you haven’t used in a while.
To add a fixture or component to a certain area or place through construction.

zh: 巧遇； 不期而遇；猛撞，撞击
note_zh:
1. When Oscar and Lenny meet, a plan is put into action.
当奥斯卡跟雷尼巧遇后，一个计划俨然成形。
2. Just last night I ran into two friends, Ken and Barbara, at a restaurant.
就在昨晚，我在餐厅里巧遇两位朋友阿肯和芭芭拉。
3. You can't pursue the learning of English very long without bumping into beauty!
在追求英语的过程中，须臾你就会与美不期而遇！
4. McCartney wheeled our bikes into the slots, crossing paths with Chinese workers who had paid a few yuan to park their bikes there for the day.
麦克卡特尼把我们的车推到停车槽中，与一些在这里花几元钱停一天车的中国员工不期而遇。
note_en: When you meet people by accident or unexpectedly.

zh: 烧成平地； 烧毁； 烧光
note_zh:
1. I do not think you ought to burn down that shed.
我看你不该烧毁那个小屋。
2. Two houses burnt down last week.
上星期有两栋房子烧毁了。
3. The woodshed burned down in half an hour.
那间柴屋只半个小时就给烧光了。
4. Burn out All of his wealth was burnt out.
他所有的财产都被烧光了。
note_en: When someone uses fire to destroy a structure.

note_zh:
1. Burn off the old paint before repainting the door.
先把门上的旧漆烧掉，再刷新油漆。
2. Let's burn up all this waste paper.
咱们把这些废纸烧掉吧。
3. The area was fanned out long ago.
这一地区的土地地力早已耗尽了。
4. It looks as if oil will run out faster than coal.
石油似乎要比煤炭耗尽得快。
note_en: When a candle stops burning because there is nothing left to burn.

zh: 烧起来； 烧尽； (使)发怒
note_zh:
1. He had to blow up the fire to make it burn.
他只得把火吹旺使它烧起来。
2. The flames licked up everything.
火焰将一切烧尽。
3. Let's leave the fire to burn down and go into our tents.
丢下火让它自行烧尽，咱们进帐篷里去吧。
4. The animal's fur bristled up with anger.
那只动物因发怒而竖起了身上的毛。
note_en: To destroy something with heat or fire.

zh: 闯出； 突然 ... 起来； 大声叫喊； 突然发生
note_zh:
1. He has hewed out his path in life during these past few years.
他这几年闯出来了。
2. It would be unlikely that you carve out a career for yourself.
你不大可能闯出一番事业。
3. Jack feigns innocence out loud for Gaines' benefit.
杰克假装无辜，他大声叫喊，恳求盖恩斯放他妻女一马。
4. Fire broke out during the night.
夜间突然发生了火灾。
note_en: To suddenly do or say something.

zh: 插嘴； 插手； 干涉
note_zh:
1. Don't try to cut in while others are talking.
别人谈话时不要插嘴。
2. She broke in with some ideas of her own.
她插嘴说了一些自己的看法。
3. She disowned any hand in the matter.
她否认插手过那件事。
4. They fiddled in other governments.
他们插手他国政府的事务。
note_en: To interrupt a conversation or activity.

note_zh:
1. I'll call back at a more convenient time.
在方便的时候我会回电话的。
2. Would you please tell him to return my call?
请你告诉他给我回电话。
3. She finally took back her words.
她最终收回了自己的话。
4. The bank has begun to call its money in.
银行已开始收回资金。
note_en: To call someone again.

zh: v. 召集； 召来； 邀请； 拜访； 叫 ... 进来； 打电话； 要求归还； 收回
note_zh:
1. Summon the pupils together in the school hall.
把学生召集到学校的礼堂里。
2. Call up reserves and as many recruits as possible.
意思就是召集后备部队和尽可能多的新兵。
3. How many friends did you call in?
你邀请了多少朋友？
4. We are all invited to take part in the pageant.
我们全都被邀请参加这次盛典。
note_en: To request that someone come and help.

note_zh:
取消； 把（注意力）转移开

1. They wanted to get us to call off the strike.
他们想让我们取消这次罢工。
note_en: To cancel an event that has been previously planned.

zh: n. 给 ... 打电话； 使想起； 召集； 征召
note_zh:
1. Forgive me so early to call up you please.
请原谅我这么早给你打电话。
2. She can still call up scenes of childhood.
她仍能想起儿时的情景。
3. Round up a few friends to help you.
召集一些朋友来帮你忙。
4. Call up reserves and as many recruits as possible.
意思就是召集后备部队和尽可能多的新兵。
note_en: To be chosen to take part in a military mission.

note_zh:
1. The calm sea was dotted with brigs.
平静的海上点缀著一只只双桅横帆船。
2. The excited old lady soon calmed down.
那个激动的老太太很快就平静下来了。
3. Saeed sat beside him and warned Nuss to stay calm.
赛义德坐在努斯旁边，警告努斯保持安静。
4. He squeezed her to his breast and calmed her down.
他把她紧抱在怀中，使她安静下来。
note_en: To become less violent, nervous, excited or angry.

note_zh:
1. The sick child was well cared for night and day.
那个生病的孩子日夜受到很好的看护。
2. It seemed to be her mission to care for her brother's children.
照顾她兄弟的孩子似乎成了她一生的使命。
3. I'm fond of her but I don't care for her husband.
我喜欢她，但不喜欢她丈夫。
4. He likes pop; he doesn't care for classic music.
他喜欢流行歌曲，不喜欢古典音乐。
note_en: To nurture or take care of someone or something.

zh: 带走； 冲走； 搬走； 冲昏 ... 的头脑
note_zh:
1. The child had been spirited away during the night.
那孩子在夜里被偷偷地带走了。
2. Don't run away the impression that I need money.
不要轻易带走我需要钱的印象。
3. The flood washed the bridge away.
洪水把那座桥冲走了。
4. He has shifted the rug away from the window.
他已把地毯从窗口搬走了。
note_en: To do something out of the ordinary due to strong emotions.

zh: 继续进行；从事，经营；发怒（经常与at连用）；与…有不正当的男女关系（常与with连用）
note_zh:
1. We'll carry on our conversation tomorrow.
我们明天将继续进行会谈。
2. After a short break, the match went on.
经过短暂的休息，比赛继续进行。
note_en: To continue doing something or to continue on in life despite an obstacle.

note_zh:
1. He will carry out his plan.
他要执行他的计划。
2. He hasn't the funds to carry out his design.
他没有资金来施行他的设计。
3. He made no attempt to carry out his undertaking.
他无意实现他的诺言。
4. Officers must carry out the wishes of members.
官员们必须实现委员们的愿望。
note_en: To move something or someone from one place to another using your arms or an object.
To understand or realize something.

zh: 赶上；很快拾起；缠住；了解近况，叙旧
note_zh:
1. She walked too slowly to catch up with us.
她走得太慢，跟不上我们。
2. Staff must stay behind after hours to catch up on their work.
下班後工作人员需要留下来把工作赶完。
3. The thief caught up the money and ran away.
小偷一把抓起钱,逃之夭夭。
4. Old age and infirmity had begun to catch up with him.
他开始显出年老体衰的样子了。
note_en: To move faster to reach someone or something that is ahead of you.

note_zh:
1. Bill take stock of the situation after Christine cheat on him.
在克丽丝汀欺骗了他後，比尔评估一下现状。
note_en: When you are emotionally and/or sexually unfaithful to your girlfriend/boyfriend or spouse.

note_zh:
1. Where can I check in?
在哪儿办理登记手续？
2. Passengers should check in for flight BA 125 to Berlin.
去柏林的英航125航班旅客请办理登机手续。
3. Passengers should check in one hour before their flight time at the latest.
乘客至迟应在班机起飞前一小时办理登机手续。
4. You can check in at the reception desk.
你可到接待处登记报到。
note_en: To register at a hotel or airport upon arrival.

zh: v.退房结帐；死；检验；通过考核；盖章
note_zh:
1. Mrs. Hyde has checked out this morning.
海德夫人今天上午已经结帐走了。
2. The hotel insists that guests check out of their rooms before 11 o'clock in the morning.
这家旅馆一定要客人在上午11点钟前结帐后离开房间。
3. Mr Cass checked out before they reached the hospital.
他们到医院之前卡斯先生就死了。
note_en: To leave a hotel or other form of an accommodation after your stay there.

zh: 因害怕而停止做某事； 退缩
note_zh:
1. Many people drew back out of fear.
许多人都因为害怕而退缩了。
2. I know at that crucial moment I'd cop out.
我知道在那种生死关头我会退缩的。
note_en: To refrain from doing something because of fear.

note_zh:
1. Onions must be chopped up to make a salad.
要做凉拌菜得把洋葱剁碎。
2. I cut up the meat for cooking meat ball.
我把肉剁碎后做肉丸子。
note_en: To cut something into pieces with a knife.

zh: 把 ... 打扫干净； 清光
note_zh:
1. I clean out my wallet.
我整理钱包。
2. She cleaned out her savings in a short time.
她在短时间内把全部积蓄都花光了。
3. It's gone clean out of my mind.
我已忘得精光。
4. It's time you clean out the drawers of your desk; they are full of old paper.
是你应该把你的抽屉清除干净的时候了，里面全是废纸。
note_en: To clean or clear the inside of something thoroughly.

zh: 清除； 赶走； 离开
note_zh:
1. Our job is to clear away the rubbish.
我们的工作是清除这些垃圾。
2. The boat will sink unless we bail out.
我们要不把积水清除掉，船就要沉了。
3. She turfed the cat out of the chair.
她把猫从椅子上赶走。
4. He was thrust out just for speaking the truth.
他被赶走，只是因为讲了真话。
note_en: To remove things completely from an area or place.

zh: 打扫； 清理； (天气)放晴； 澄清
note_zh:
1. It's very likely to clear up by and by.
很可能不久要放晴了。
2. Let me clear up the broken glass before someone walks on it.
在有人踩上碎玻璃之前让我把它清扫一下。
3. We should clean up the past-due bills.
我们应该清理逾期票据。
4. I must spend a few days to clear off all my work.
我必须用几天功夫来清理我所有的工作。
note_en: To do something to solve a problem or a misunderstanding.
When something in a drain or valve prevents the flow of water or other liquids

note_zh:
1. They have decided to close that branch down.
他们决定把那个分公司关闭掉。
2. The theatre has had to close for lack of support.
这家剧院光顾者寡只好关闭。
3. The firm has decided to close down its branch here.
这家商行已决定让这里的支店停业。
4. The factory may shut down if supplies cease.
缺少货源工厂就可能停业。
note_en: When the activities or services of a business permanently end.

zh: 把 ... 隔离开来； 使隔绝
note_zh:
1. A section of a waterway, such as a canal, closed off with gates, in which vessels in transit are raised or lowered by raising or lowering the water level of that section.
水闸用门关住的水道的一部分，如运河。其中通过升高或降低这部分的水位可以抬升或压低运输中的船只
2. A movable structure used to close off an entrance, typically consisting of a panel that swings on hinges or that slides or rotates.
门一种用于关闭入口活动装置，典型的由一块板上有铰链转动或为拉动式或为旋转式的组合
note_en: To block an entrance or pathway.

zh: 发生，产生，实现；【航海】抢风调向，改变方向
note_zh:
1. How did it come about that he knew where we were?
他是怎么知道我们在什麽地方的呢？
2. Expected or required but not yet having come about.
期待发生的被期望或要求但仍未发生的
3. How did this come about?
这是怎么发生的?
note_en: When something happens or occurs.

zh: v.碰到；遇到；无意中发现；被理解
note_zh:
1. We've just come across an old friend.
我们刚碰到了一位老朋友。
2. Perhaps I shall come across him in France.
也许我会在法国遇见他。
3. I came across this book in an old bookstore in London.
我在伦敦一家旧书店里发现了这本书。
4. He spoke for a long time but his meaning did not really come across.
他讲了很长时间，但他的意思没有人真正理解。
note_en: The way other people perceive something or someone.

note_zh:
1. The teapot just came apart in my hands.
茶壶就在我手中裂开了。
2. The camera just come apart the first time he used it.
这相机在他第一次使用时就破了。
note_en: When something breaks or separates piece by piece.

note_zh:
n.回来；恢复(知觉、记忆等）；回想起；卷土重来；重新流行；反驳

1. There is no telling when she will come back.
说不准她什么时候回来。
2. He came back in the late afternoon.
他在傍晚回来。
3. I came back from my holiday with renewed strength.
我度假回来，体力得到恢复。
4. The holiday gave him back his good spirits.
假期使他恢复了愉快的情绪。
note_en: To return to a place.

zh: v.下降，落下，（价格等）跌落；潦倒，崩溃；流传
note_zh:
1. The grain crop has gone down this year.
今年的粮食作物产量下降了。
2. Sale is down a bit due to the revaluation.
由于货币升值销售额有下降。
3. He landed on his feet after being down and out.
经过贫困潦倒以后，他重新站了起来。
4. Since he lost the job, he has really come down in the world.
自从他失业以后，他的确过着穷困潦倒的生活。
note_en: To move from a higher to a lower position or from north to south.

note_zh:
1. Our choices come down to ging or staying.
我们的选择可归结为是去还是留的问题。
2. The issue really boils down to a clash between left and right.
这场争论确实可归结为左派与右派之间的冲突。
note_en: When a situation is reduced to a certain outcome.

zh: 得(传染性的病)； 感染
note_zh:
1. His face turned purple with rage.
他气得脸色发紫。
2. The teapot fell with an awful smash.
茶壶掉下来摔得粉碎。
3. He was infected with a latent infection.
他被感染了一种潜伏性的传染病。
4. He felt the same way deep down within him.
这的氛围深深地感染了他。
note_en: When you start to experience the symptoms of a disease or illness.

note_zh:
进来； 起作用

1. He often asked Philip to come in for a chat.
他经常邀菲利浦进来闲谈。
2. His wife dashed in breathlessly.
他的妻子上气不接下气地冲了进来。
3. The searchlights were ineffectual in the fog.
探照灯在雾中不起作用。
4. The new traffic regulations have come into play.
新的交通规则起作用了。
note_en: When someone or something enters a place, building, or room.

zh: 能够去掉；举行；发生；成功；从…掉下
note_zh:
1. These stains won't come off, I'm afraid.
我看，这些污点去不掉。
2. The tennis finals will come off tomorrow.
网球决赛将于明天举行。
3. Did your proposed trip to Rome ever come off?
你提出的到罗马旅行，后来去了吗？
4. Her attempt to break the world record nearly came off.
她想要打破世界纪录，已接近成功。
note_en: When something is removed or breaks off from where it was originally attached to.

zh: v.突然产生；要求；降临；开始；进步；赶快；上演；上台；成长，发展；<口>加油；别胡扯
note_zh:
1. Suddenly it came on me where I had lost my keys.
我突然记起把钥匙丢在哪里了。
2. My parents have never come on us for anything.
我的父母从来没向我们要求过任何东西。
3. It's getting colder: winter is coming on.
天渐冷了，冬天来了。
4. I think I have a cold coming on.
我看我要感冒了。
note_en: To appear on television or be heard on the radio.

zh: vi.出现；显露；出版；结果是；公开表态；被算出，被解出；表明态度，提出主张
note_zh:
1. Bats come out only at night.
蝙蝠只在晚上出来活动。
2. Hot weather makes her come out in a rash.
因天气炎热，她起了皮疹。
3. Her best qualities come out in a crisis.
在危急关头显露出了她的优秀品质。
4. That magazine comes out once a month.
那个杂志每月出一期。
note_en: To leave a place.

note_zh:
v.从远处来；改变立场；顺便来访；突然感觉；有清晰的收听或收看效果；欺骗

1. He has come over to China for the summer.
他不远万里来中国度暑假。
2. After a long debate they all came over to our side.
经过长时间的辩论，他们全站到我们这一边来了。
3. You really must come over sometime and have dinner with us.
你确实应该找个时间过来, 跟我们一起吃顿饭。
4. A feeling of nausea came over her.
她突然有种想吐的感觉。
note_en: To make a visit.

zh: 经历； 脱险； 安然度过
note_zh:
1. They went through the agonies of war and famine.
他们经历了战争和饥荒的痛苦。
2. The country has gone through too many wars.
这个国家经历了太多的战争。
3. She was luck to come through the war.
她很幸运在战争中脱险了。
4. It's a wonder that the child came through without a scratch.
这孩子竟能安然无恙地脱险，真是奇迹。
note_en: When someone or something expected arrives.

zh: vi.上升，升起；靠近，走进；提升；提及，被讨论；长出；上庭受审
note_zh:
1. The snowdrops are just beginning to come up.
雪花莲刚刚开始长出地面。
2. You've come up in the world, haven't you?
你的地位已经上升了,是吗?
3. He came up and introdued himself.
他走上前来并作了自我介绍。
4. He was born poor,and came up the hard way.
他出身贫寒，通过坚韧不拔的努力而获成功。
note_en: When something appears or happens, either expected or unexpected.

note_zh:
赶上；提出；想出

1. I had to run to come up with him.
我得跑才能赶上他。
2. He came up with good ideas for the product promotion.
他想出一个推广产品的好方法。
3. No one has come up with a convincing explanation of why dinosaur died out.
尚未有人能对恐龙的灭绝作出一个令人信服的解释。
4. The scientists are beating their brains trying to come up with a solution to the problem.
科学家正绞尽脑汁，力求找到解决这个问题的办法。
note_en: When you think of a solution, idea, plan, or excuse.
To persuade someone to do something through lies and deception.
To persuade someone to give or do something through lies and deception.

note_zh:
1. Come on, have some tea and cool off.
来，喝点茶，凉快一下。
2. I hope the two countries will cool off a bit, or there will be a war.
我希望两个国家都冷静一点，否则将有一场战争。
3. Let's go and have icecream to cool off.
咱们去吃点冰淇淋凉快凉快吧。
4. Try walking on water to cool off an overheated ego.
在水中行走或许可以冷却过于膨胀的欲望。
note_en: To lose temperature.

note_zh:
1. That was the only thing they could count on.
那是他们唯一依靠的东西。
2. I'll count on it.
我就指望它了。
3. You can count on me.
你可以指望我。
note_en: To rely on someone for support when you need it most.

zh: 算出 ... 总数； 共计； 把 ... 相加
note_zh:
1. She blundered when she added up the bill.
她把账款相加时弄错了。
note_en: To count all of something or people in a group.
To use something to conceal something else.

zh: 对 ... 采取严厉措施； 镇压
note_zh:
1. The riot police started to crack down on them.
防暴警察开始对他们采取镇压行动。
note_en: To take more action than usual against wrongdoing.

note_zh:
1. Please cross off the wrong word in the sentence.
请将句中的错字划掉。
2. If you don't want to come, cross your name off.
如果你不想来，把你的名字划掉。
3. Eventually the project was written off as a government loss.
最终，这次计划被当作政府的一个失败而勾销了。
note_en: To remove or delete someone or something from a list.

note_zh:
1. The workers had to take a cut in pay.
工人们只得同意削减工资。
2. They are cutting back further on public spending.
他们正进行削减政府开支。
3. Mother cut back for her missing paper.
母亲急忙返回来取落下的文件。
note_en: When you spend less money on something.

zh: 削减； 删减； 击倒； 杀死
note_zh:
1. The workers had to take a cut in pay.
工人们只得同意削减工资。
2. They are trying to whittle down our salaries.
他们正著手削减我们的薪水。
3. You'd better cut your report to five pages.
你最好把报告删减到五页。
4. Not a single word in the document can be cut.
这个文件中的文字，一个也不许删减。
note_en: To do less of something or to use something in smaller amounts.
To completely remove or separate a part of something by cutting it with something sharp like a knife or a pair of scissors, etc.
To remove something using a knife or a pair of scissors.
When you use a knife or scissors to cut something into several pieces.
When you do everything you must do to solve a problem or complete.
To dispose of something.
To do something again in order to improve or correct mistakes.
To make a connection between two or more things.
To manage well without something or someone.
To go to sleep unintentionally.
To wear formal clothes, or a costume for a special occasion.
To visit someone unexpectedly or without making arrangements first.
To gradually decline/become less.
To quit a school program or training course.
To dry something or a surface quickly.
To remove water or other liquid from a container.
When all the liquid and/or moisture evaporates.
When someone consumes all their food.
To remove everyone or everything from a space.
The end result of something planned or unplanned.
When something breaks all at once or piece by piece.
To move slower than others.
To fall to the ground.
When you have an intense attraction to something or someone.
When something drops to a lower level.
To fall from or through something.
When someone or something falls from an upright position to the ground.
If things do not go as planned, or if a plan, deal or agreement fails.
When you have/don’t have the energy and confidence to do something.
When you defend yourself/resist an attack, or make an effort against an opponent in a competition.
To expect or plan for something.
To add personal information in the blank spaces of an official document.
To complete a form.
To fill something completely.
To become aware of something or someone.
To make plans or arrangements with someone or for others.
To become very mad or lose control over your emotions.
When an object or a person is near, but you cannot pinpoint the exact location.
To find out more about something, or take further action in regards to it.
To waste time doing unimportant or silly things.
When someone becomes irrationally upset or angry, sometimes to the point of confusion.
To become successful in the professional environment or make consistent progress in life.
To have good interactions with others.
To do something that needed to get done at an earlier time.
To escape from something.
To return to a place.
To get revenge.
When you talk to someone at a later time either because you are busy or you have obtained additional or new information.
To learn, work, or progress more slowly than others.
To pass someone or something.
To move to a lower place or level.
To arrive or enter a place, room, building, etc.
To leave a form of transportation, except a car.
To be excited or to truly enjoy doing something.
When you move your body and either stand, sit, lie, kneel, etc. towards something (non-separable).
To leave or escape.
To receive a benefit and/or satisfaction from doing something.

zh: (自生病或失望中) 復原，痊癒
note_en: To move past an obstacle to the other side.
To finish something that needs to get done.
When a message, meaning, or idea is understood or accepted.
To arrive to or assist someone to a place.
To meet and spend time together.
To move to a higher level/position.
To give something for free or without expecting anything in return.
To surrender to something.
To distribute something.
To stop doing something without completing it.
To take the necessary steps to get something done.
When you do your best to get something no matter how difficult it is.
To proceed to do something that you were hesitant about.
to accept or agree with a decision, rule, opinion, etc.
To follow a circular path.
To move or travel from one place to another place.
To return to a place, time, activity, or a person.
When you fail to fulfill a promise you made to someone.
To be more than or better than what is normal or expected.
To pass someone or something quickly.
To move to a lower position, place, price, level, etc.
To try to obtain.
To enter a place, building, room, etc.
To enter a place or area for a specific reason.
To enter a place, room, building, etc. usually through a door.
To leave unannounced.
When something takes place.
To leave a place or area you’re in.
To review something.
When you make a decision to do something, and actually do it.
To move or extend to a higher level or farther North.
To accompany someone to a place.
To waste time doing silly or unimportant things.
To be disgusted with someone or something.
To become too big or too tall for your clothes.
When you physically change from a child to an adult.
When you return something to the person who owns it after the person has given it to you
To give something to a person of authority.
To distribute something free to other people.
To give upon request or demand.
To spend time in a place or an area.
When you hold something, often for support of comfort.
To hang something, usually wet clothes, to dry.
To hang clothes or an object on a hook, hanger or rod.
To wear clothing, cosmetics, perfume, etc.
To go to a place where you’ve been before or where you started from.
When a situation becomes more likely.
To move in the direction where someone or something is.
When you learn details about something or someone.
When you learn about something or someone.
To make something warmer or cause a rise in temperature.
To assist people with something.
To suddenly have a solution to a problem or an interesting idea.
When you don’t forgive or have little respect for someone because of something they did.
To delay something.
When you wait for a short time.
To extend your hand or an object in front of you.
To hold someone or something up in the air.
When you connect two electrical devices together.
To do something quickly.
To continue doing an activity even though it may be difficult.
To avoid getting close to someone or something.
To make sound, music and noise minimal.
To stop yourself or other people from doing something.
To avoid discussing a particular subject or topic.
To continue doing something.
When you don’t share information.
To continue to do something.
To illegally pay extra money to someone as part of the price.
To force someone to leave an organization or place.
To use force to cause someone or something to fall from its place, whether intentionally or accidentally.
When someone is struck hard enough to cause them to lose consciousness.
To make contact with something or someone in such a way it or they fall.
To have knowledge of or be familiar with something.
To place something on a surface or an object.
When a company or business ends a worker’s employment.
When a period of time or a series of events cause an event, situation or conversation to happen.
When you don’t take something or someone with you when you leave.
To accidentally or intentionally not include a person or thing on a list.
To not include someone or something.
When you have a portion that still remains from something after you have used or eaten the rest of it.
To disappoint someone.
To allow someone or something to enter a place.
To allow someone to leave a car, bus, train etc.
To tell something that is a secret or private.
When you give permission for someone to leave or be released from a place.
When someone or something becomes less intense or strong.
To be lazy or to not do anything.
To raise someone or something to a higher level.
To illuminate something.
When a conversation is changed or a person changes to become less serious.
To form in a row one after another or side-by-side.
To share the same residence.
To secure people or things behind a closed door.
When you don’t have the key or passcode to enter a secured place.
When you shut the windows and doors of a place or building.
To turn your head to see what or who is around you.
To divert your eyes to someone or something.
When you consider someone or something as unimportant or with little to no value. The opposite of yesterday’s phrasal verb.
To anticipate a future event because it either makes you happy and/or you benefit from it.
To investigate or get more facts about something.
To remain alert.
To examine or inspect something or someone.

zh: 尋找 (某物)，在 (字典中) 查明
note_en: When a situation becomes better.
This particular phrasal verb is used to say you view someone with respect and/or admiration.
To have exceptionally good luck.
To go in a certain direction, typically in a hurry.
To understand the meaning of something.
To invent a story.
When something is dirty or unorganized.
To put or combine different things together so they’ll merge successfully.
To try to play with or repair a device that you have no true knowledge about.
When you bring your personal belongings and stuff to a new place where you will live. Yesterday’s phrasal verb, Move Out, has the opposite meaning.
When you permanently remove all your belongings and personal items from a place where you live or stay.
To reduce the number of options or possibilities.
When you return money that you owe someone.
To purchase merchandise.
To repay money that is owed to a person or entity.
To pay all the money that is owed or asked for.
To tease and/or criticize someone over a period of time.
When you are able to recognize something or someone from a group.
To get someone or something from somewhere.
To put things in a pile or heap.
[Informal] To be angry about something.
To prepare for a future event or situation.
To prepare for a big event or expectation in the future.
When you have the intention to do something.
To connect an electrical device to an electrical outlet.
To connect an electrical appliance/machine to another piece of equipment or to a power source.
To block a narrow passage such as a hole, drain, or pipe so that nothing can flow through.
To make someone aware of something.
When you aim at something or someone using your finger or hand.
To produce a hard copy of a computer document.
To succeed in doing something difficult or tricky.
When something or someone leaves a place.
To drive your vehicle to the side of the road to stop.
To recover from an injury or illness.
To enter data or record time on a device.
To record the time you leave the workplace using a special clock.
To place something where it cannot be seen or isn’t in the way of other things.
When something is causing a project to slow down.
To place something on a surface or an object.
When you invest or make a deposit. In this example, the amount almost always separates the verb.
To become offended by someone or something.
To extend a part of your body.
To not be surprised by a person’s actions. [Always used with the negative]
To cause someone or something to be in a certain state or to do something extra.
To assemble or connect the parts of something.
To move an object to a higher level.
To encourage or persuade someone to do something.
To tolerate or accept something that you’d rather not.
To call someone on the phone.
When someone asks for a price for something that is too high, when someone cheats or steals.
To tear something (i.e. paper, cloth, etc.) into pieces.
When someone or something is excluded as a possibility.
To move or run from one side to the other.
To go from one place to another in a hurry.
To hit someone or something with a vehicle.
When something collides with another object by accident.
When people exit a place very quickly. Run In/ Run Into is the opposite of this meaning.
When someone is injured or killed by a vehicle.
To run from a lower elevation or level to a higher elevation or level.
To ensure the top of a container/bottle is sealed.
To cheat or deceive someone.
To make a mistake or do something really bad.
To seriously think about doing something.
When all the inventory of a particular product has been purchased.
To organize or plan for an activity/event to happen.
To begin living a stable and routine life.
To accept something even though it’s not what you want or need.
To mix something in a container by shaking it.
To overly display your skills or what you have.
To stop the operation of an electrical or mechanical device.
To stop talking.
To write your name on a list to indicate the day and time you arrived at a certain place.
To write your name on a list to indicate the day and time of your departure.
To change from a standing to a sitting position.
To do something slower.
To enter a place quietly to avoid being seen or heard.
To leave a place without being noticed.
To arrange or separate things into groups according to similarities.
When someone’s attention is not in the present moment. [Adj.] {spaced out} To describe a person whose attention isn’t in the present moment.
To stand in one place or area when you should be doing something.
To support or represent an idea, belief, etc.
To rise from sitting or lying down to a vertical position.
The beginning of an event, activity or time period.
To begin a trip or venture to some place.
To start something.
To avoid discussing a certain subject or topic.
To spend time out of your own home.
To remain in a place that is higher than ground level.
To place your foot on something or someone.
To stay in a place or with someone for any period of time.
To extend something outward.
When something is attached to another by some form of adhesive.
To use a weapon, especially a gun, to rob someone.
To continue to use or do something.
To make a quick stop on your way to a destination.
To visit someone for a short period of time.
To make something straight.
To feel very worried, nervous or anxious.
When you move something from the ‘on’ state to the ‘off’ state. Synonymous with “Turn Off.” Yesterday’s “Switch On” is the opposite.
When you move something from the ‘off’ state to the ‘on’ state. Synonymous with “Turn On,” while “Switch Off” is the opposite.
To disconnect or separate the parts of an object.
To return something or someone.
To be successfully tricked or deceived by someone.
To remove an object from an area, place or container.
To direct your anger towards someone or something when you’re really upset about someone or something else.
When you accept an invitation or offer from someone.
To talk to someone as if they are less intelligent than you by conveying a tone of voice or attitude that says so.
To convince someone to do something.
To convince someone not to do something.
To have a conversation with someone.
To deconstruct a building or home.
To remove with force.
To be able to differentiate something or someone from something or someone else.
To inform an authoritative figure about what someone else did.
To consider something prior to making a final decision.
To think and plan carefully for a future situation or event.
To use your imagination to create a plan, idea, or a solution.
To dispose of something you no longer find useful in a waste bin, trash, etc.
When you get rid of something by putting it in a trash can, bin, etc.
To vomit or puke.
To locate someone or something after a long search
To exchange something old for something new.
To convince or persuade someone to believe something untrue or to do something for you.
To see how something fits or looks before purchasing.
To show that you are qualified to do something.
When someone or something moves until it faces the opposite direction.
To decrease the temperature, sound, etc.
To give someone or something to the police or someone of authority.
To transform.
To stop a device from functioning.
To cause someone to feel interested and/or attracted.
To attend an event, meeting, etc.
To move an object so that the part that is on top becomes the bottom and vice versa.
To increase the controls of an electronic or mechanical device.
To completely consume or use all of a supply.
When you are finished sleeping.
To remove dirt or unwanted markings with soap and water.
To clean your face, hands, body, etc.
To be aware of someone or something.
To make the surface or top of something disappear due to friction.
To decrease or disappear gradually.
When something is damaged or weakened from use and age.
To operate a mechanical device by turning its handle.
To completely remove or clean something from a surface or location.
To clean the inside of something.
To remove liquid from a surface using a sponge, towel or cloth, etc.
To make time in a busy schedule for a person or an activity.
When a situation, event, plan, or idea is successful.
To gradually improve at or make progress in something.
To cover something with some kind of special paper.
To close an item that has a zipper.
